crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: INDICATOR-COMPROMISE IRC channel join on non-standard port
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert tcp $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET !6666:7000 ( msg:"INDICATOR-COMPROMISE IRC channel join on non-standard port"; flow:to_server,established; isdataat:!139; content:"JOIN #",depth 6; metadata:policy max-detect-ips drop; service:irc; classtype:trojan-activity; sid:20092; rev:10; )

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: INDICATOR-COMPROMISE IRC nick change on non-standard port
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert tcp $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET !6666:7000 ( msg:"INDICATOR-COMPROMISE IRC nick change on non-standard port"; flow:to_server,established; isdataat:!99; content:"NICK ",depth 5; metadata:policy max-detect-ips drop; service:irc; classtype:trojan-activity; sid:38933; rev:3; )

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_category: A client was using an unusual port
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET POLICY IRC Channel JOIN on non-standard port
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert tcp $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET ![25,587,6666:7000,8076] (msg:"ET POLICY IRC Channel JOIN on non-standard port"; flow:established,to_server; dsize:<64; content:"JOIN "; nocase; depth:5; pcre:"/&|#|\+|!/R"; reference:url,www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc1459#section-4.2.1; classtype:unusual-client-port-connection; sid:2000348; rev:18; metadata:attack_target Client_and_Server, created_at 2010_07_30, deployment Perimeter, performance_impact Moderate, confidence Medium, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2023_05_09, reviewed_at 2024_09_16; target:src_ip;)
alert ( gid:116; sid:58; rev:2; msg:"(tcp) experimental TCP options found"; metadata: policy max-detect-ips drop, rule-type decode; classtype:protocol-command-decode;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET INFO IRC Nick change on non-standard port
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert tcp $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET !6666:7000 (msg:"ET INFO IRC Nick change on non-standard port"; flow:to_server,established; dsize:<64; content:"NICK "; depth:5; content:!"twitch.tv|0d 0a|"; classtype:misc-activity; sid:2000345; rev:17; metadata:created_at 2010_07_30, confidence High, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2022_11_28, reviewed_at 2024_09_16;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET INFO DYNAMIC_DNS Query to a *.ftp .sh Domain
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert dns $HOME_NET any -> any any (msg:"ET INFO DYNAMIC_DNS Query to a *.ftp .sh Domain"; dns.query; content:".ftp.sh"; fast_pattern; nocase; endswith; reference:url,freedns.afraid.org/domain/registry/; classtype:bad-unknown; sid:2039972; rev:2; metadata:attack_target Client_and_Server, created_at 2022_11_28, deployment Perimeter, performance_impact Low, confidence High, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2023_03_02, mitre_tactic_id TA0011, mitre_tactic_name Command_And_Control, mitre_technique_id T1568, mitre_technique_name Dynamic_Resolution;)

threat_severity.level_description: Severity MEDIUM because it was considered trojan.

crowdsourced_ai_results.analysis:
The Perl script is an IRC bot. It connects to an IRC server, joins specified channels, and responds to commands.

The script starts by setting up signal handlers to ignore certain signals. It then uses several Perl modules, including `IO::Socket`, `Socket`, and `IO::Select`. It changes the current directory to the root directory ("/").

The script defines several subroutines:

*   `getnick()`: Returns a randomly generated nickname, prefixed with "Rig".
*   `getident()`: Attempts to retrieve an identifier from a URL. If that fails (or based on a random condition), it returns the current nick.
*   `getname()`: Retrieves a name from a URL.
*   `getident2()`: Generates a random string.
*   `getstore()`: Downloads a file from a given URL and saves it locally. It uses the `_get` subroutine.
*   `_get()`: Retrieves content from a URL, optionally using a proxy specified in environment variables. It calls `_trivial_http_get`.
*   `_trivial_http_get()`: Sends an HTTP GET request to a server and retrieves the response.
*   `sendraw()`: Sends a raw message to the IRC server.
*   `conectar()`: Establishes a connection to the IRC server.
*   `parse()`: Parses messages received from the IRC server. It handles PING requests, VERSION/PING CTCP requests, admin commands and nick changes.
*   `bfunc()`: Contains several bot functionalities that are executed via forking. These include:
    *   `portscan`: Scans predefined ports on a host.
    *   `download`: Downloads a file from a URL using `getstore`.
    *   `fullportscan`: Scans all ports in a specified range on a host.
    *   `udp`: Sends UDP packets to a specified host and port for a specified duration.
    *   `udpfaixa`: Sends UDP packets to an IP range, port and duration specified.
    *   `conback`: Creates a reverse shell.
    *   `oldpack`: Executes the `attacker` subroutine which sends various types of packets to a host.
*   `ircase()`: Handles IRC commands such as JOIN, PART, OP, DEOP, VOICE, DEVOICE, MSG, CTCP, NICK, etc.
*   `shell()`: Executes shell commands on the system using backticks.
*   `attacker()`: Sends a barrage of different packet types (ICMP, IGMP, UDP, TCP, and RAW) to a target IP address.

The script then enters a main loop where it continuously checks for data from the IRC server. When data is received, it is parsed and handled accordingly.

The `DCC` package implements DCC (Direct Client-to-Client) functionality, allowing the bot to send and receive files directly.

The script retrieves configuration information such as the server address, port, channels to join, and administrator nicks.

Obfuscated Code:

*   The initial process name is overwritten with `$0="$processo"."\0";` where `$processo` is `/usr/sbin/sshd`.
*   The port number for the IRC connection is constructed using `chr()` calls: `my $porta= chr(54) . chr(54) . chr(54) . chr(55) ;`.

Remote File Downloads:

*   The script downloads the bot's nick from `http://websurvey.burstmedia.com/names.txt` (commented out).
*   The script attempts to download the bot's ident from `http://www.minpop.com/sk12pack/idents.php`.
*   The script attempts to download the bot's real name from `http://www.minpop.com/sk12pack/names.php`.
*   The `getstore` subroutine downloads files from arbitrary URLs.
